title: From First Date To Soulmate: How To Know If You're On The Right Track
summary: The happiest relationships are the ones where both people give each other enough space to be themselves. Relationships often work best when they’re a mix of two lives coming together. Open and honest communication is a crucial part of any successful relationship. If you’ve been able to tackle difficult conversations and come out stronger as a result, it’s a good sign that you're on the right track. If your partner is your biggest cheerleader and has your back through thick and thin, it doesn’t just support you. In a healthy relationship, both partners are there for each other, supporting each other through the good times and the bad.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are so many first date horror stories out there \u2014 awkward silences, strange amateur- magician tricks, and cringe-worthy pick-up lines being just a few of them. But getting past these awkward initial stages and finding a potential partner who you can connect with on a deeper level is no mean feat. Figuring out if someone is your soulmate or simply the first step to becoming one isn\u2019t easy. Even though it can feel like we\u2019re constantly being bombarded with images of fairy tale love and meet-cute romances, dating in real life isn\u2019t always so straightforward. Unless you\u2019re living under a rock, you probably know that letting somebody into your private world isn\u2019t something to take lightly.
But how do you know if you\u2019re on the right track when it comes to dating? Whether you\u2019ve just met someone new and want to get to know them better without rushing things or have been seeing somebody for some time and are wondering if they could be The One, here are some signs that could indicate that this person may be more than just a casual partner\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"You feel happy and comfortable when you\u2019re together."),mdx("p",null,"The happiest relationships are the ones where both people give each other enough space to be themselves. They\u2019re not constantly clinging to each other or trying to dictate each other\u2019s actions. If you both feel happy and comfortable when you\u2019re together, then it\u2019s a good indication that you\u2019re on the right track. If, on the other hand, you feel as though you have to be constantly on your best behavior, or you\u2019re always feeling as though the other person is trying to get too close for comfort, then you don\u2019t have the right formula for success. Finding somebody who respects you for who you really are and vice versa is, after all, one of the most important things you can look for when dating."),mdx("h2",null,"You have similar core values."),mdx("p",null,"The person you end up dating could become your future partner, your best friend and your lover all rolled into one. But, if you have completely different values, it\u2019s unlikely that you\u2019ll feel as though you\u2019re on the right track. If, however, you have similar core values, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. Relationships often work best when they\u2019re a mix of two lives coming together. It\u2019s not as though you\u2019re each trying to change the other person, but you do have to understand each other\u2019s views on certain core issues and have similar ways of dealing with them. If you\u2019re both on the same page when it comes to values, values that encourage each of you to be the best versions of yourselves and support each other through the highs and lows of life, you\u2019re on the right track."),mdx("h2",null,"You\u2019ve been able to tackle difficult conversations and come out stronger as a result."),mdx("p",null,"When we\u2019re seeing somebody new, it\u2019s crucial to find ways to communicate and engage with each other that don\u2019t trigger us or make us feel as though we\u2019re walking on eggshells. If you\u2019ve been able to have a difficult conversation with your partner and come out stronger as a result, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. You might not get everything right the first time, but open and honest communication is a crucial part of any successful relationship. If you\u2019ve been able to talk about what each of you want from the relationship, any issues you\u2019ve faced, and how you\u2019re both feeling now, then it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. Any relationship will face difficult times, but if you\u2019ve been able to deal with them maturely and learn from the experience, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track."),mdx("h2",null,"He/she makes you feel more confident about yourself."),mdx("p",null,"One of the signs that you\u2019re on the right track with your partner is if he or she makes you feel more confident about yourself. If you\u2019ve been on a couple of dates with someone and you\u2019re feeling more confident about yourself as a person, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. This person has a positive impact on you and makes you feel more connected to yourself. If, on the other hand, you\u2019re still struggling to feel comfortable in your own skin, or you feel as though you\u2019re faking it until you make it, then you\u2019re not on the right track yet. It\u2019s important to feel at ease with yourself when you\u2019re dating someone. You don\u2019t want to feel as though you\u2019re playing a part or trying to be somebody you\u2019re not. If you\u2019re dating somebody who makes you feel more confident about yourself, you\u2019re on the right track."),mdx("h2",null,"He/she is your biggest cheerleader."),mdx("p",null,"If your partner is your biggest cheerleader and has your back through thick and thin, that\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. If, on the other hand, they\u2019re constantly putting you down or telling you what you\u2019re doing wrong, it doesn\u2019t look good. In a healthy relationship, both partners are there for each other, lifting each other up and supporting each other through both the good times and the bad. If your partner is there for you when you need them, but also encourages you to follow your dreams, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. This person doesn\u2019t just support you when it\u2019s convenient for them. They\u2019re there for you through thick and thin and have your best interests at heart. If he or she truly is your biggest cheerleader, you\u2019re on the right track."),mdx("h2",null,"The thought of being without him/her doesn\u2019t sound very appealing."),mdx("p",null,"If the thought of being without your partner doesn\u2019t sound very appealing, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. If, on the other hand, you feel as though you\u2019d be able to shrug the relationship off and move on, then you\u2019re not on the right track yet. Finding somebody who makes you want to be with them, who you feel comfortable being yourself around and who makes you want to commit to a relationship with them is a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. It\u2019s normal to feel sad when a relationship ends, but if you\u2019re dreading the thought of being without this person, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. This person is the right person for you and you for them. You should enjoy being around them, and you should feel like you\u2019re a better person when you\u2019re with them."),mdx("h2",null,"The relationship is built on trust and commitment."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re dating somebody and the relationship is built on trust and commitment, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track. Relationships need time to grow and develop, and, while you might be able to spot the signs that you\u2019re on the right track, they might not be easy to see or notice at first. If, on the other hand, you\u2019re constantly feeling as though you\u2019re rushing into things or that the relationship has no real foundation, you\u2019re probably not on the right track yet. It\u2019s easy to get caught up in the excitement of a new relationship, but you have to make sure that you\u2019re not rushing into things and making decisions that could have long-term repercussions on both your life and your relationship. If you\u2019ve been dating somebody for a while and you feel as though the relationship is built on trust and commitment, it\u2019s a good sign that you\u2019re on the right track."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How the Pandemic Is Changing the Way We Work

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Time is money, as the saying goes. And when you\u2019re grappling with pandemic disease and a global outbreak, time spent at work has a whole different set of implications.
Pandemic flu strains have decimated human populations since the first recorded pandemic in 541 AD. Over the centuries, outbreaks have been frequent enough to instill fear in even the most stoic among us.
Today we face another pandemic threat with the potential to be even more devastating than those which came before it. A highly virulent strain of influenza A virus known as influenza pandemia has begun spreading rapidly throughout much of the world.
In many ways, today\u2019s workplace is very different from that of a century ago. Technology has advanced; office structures are more open and collaborative; and workers are expected to demonstrate self-motivation and flexibility in order to thrive in an ever-changing workplace environment.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Tips for Eating Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you trying to eat healthier but find that healthy foods are expensive? Are you trying to make a good meal last for several days and not just one? Are you struggling to find affordable, healthy options near your home or work? If so, you\u2019re not alone. Eating healthy can be expensive and challenging. The cost of healthy food has gone up while the cost of unhealthy food has gone down. But this doesn\u2019t mean that eating healthy is impossible; it just means we all need to get a little bit more creative.
Eating well on a budget can be challenging, but it isn\u2019t impossible. Making smart choices about what you buy as well as how you cook your food can make a big difference in how much money you spend on food each month and how healthy your diet is at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Resolution to Get Fit a Reality
How to Stay Organized and Sane as a Busy Mom
10 Easy Tips for Sticking to Your New Year's Resolutions

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New Year\u2019s resolutions are like a clean slate for the coming year. What you do with that opportunity is up to you. Maybe you resolve to eat healthier, exercise more or reduce stress and anxiety. Maybe you decide to learn a new skill, read more books, help others or travel more. Or maybe your resolution is to do something completely different \u2014 like learn a language, stop procrastinating or read the complete works of Shakespeare. The possibilities are endless, but sticking to those resolutions can be challenging. The key is establishing habits that will last all 365 days of the year and not just one crazy day in January. It takes small but deliberate changes in everyday life that add up over time and become second nature. Here are 10 easy tips for sticking to your New Year\u2019s resolutions:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Beat the Winter Blues

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The winter blues is a mood disorder that can affect anyone, not just people from northern regions. Symptoms of the winter blues are essentially SAD (seasonal affective disorder) brought on by the shorter days and colder temperatures of winter. If you find yourself feeling blue during the colder months but don\u2019t necessarily have a reason to be, you might have the winter blues. The good news is that you can combat this feeling with a little help from your friends and some lifestyle changes.
Whether you have or have had the winter blues in the past, there are ways to boost your spirits when those long, dreary days of January creep up on you like an old friend you don\u2019t want to see again. Here are some ways to beat those pesky winter blues and get back to your happy self!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
